<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H7171|קֶרֶץ]]</big>**</small>
 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קְרַץ‎</span>] **noun [masculine]** ==piece== ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]; see Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קרץ‎</span>); — plural suffix <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קַרְצ֫וֺהִי‎</span> [[Dan.6.25|Dan 6:25]], <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎צֵיהוֺן‎</span>- [[Dan.3.8|Dan 3:8]], both in phrase <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲכַ֫לוּ ק‎</span>, i.e. ***accuse maliciously*** (so [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] Syriac [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>3756</sup> (compare Old Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אמר כרצי פ‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>299</sup> [[BDB#Cook|SAC]]<sup>66</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>205 f.</sup>; <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כרץ‎</span> also Mandean), probably borrowed from Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***karƒe akâlu***</u></abbr>, ***malign***, ***slander*** (often; also Tel Amarna); compare also <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***u‡tarrizu***</u></abbr> [[BDB#Hamm|Hamm]]<sup>Law 161</sup>; further Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***, and kindred phrase; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>489</sup>).
